title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse and modify them later in a program. Think of them as labeled boxes that hold information like numbers or text.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful?

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat an action multiple times automatically. For loops run a known number of times, while while loops run until a condition changes.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Functions
summary: Functions are named blocks of code that perform a specific task. They help make code modular, reusable, and easier to test.
sample_question: What is a function and how does it help organize code?
